meaning_mnemonic: In the <radical>rain</radical> I take my <radical>rake</radical> and shake it, making a <kanji>demand</kanji> that the rain stop! I demand this rain stop right now! Don’t make me shake my rake more violently than I am currently shaking it!
You get <radical>tooth</radical> <radical>orders</radical>. You get these tooth orders various times in your life, depending on your <kanji>age</kanji>.
By showing the <radical>roof</radical> of your <radical>top hat</radical> you send your <kanji>best regards</kanji>.
You have <radical>thread</radical> and some <radical>syrup</radical> and you need to <kanji>spin</kanji> them together. Drip the syrup onto the thread and spin it around and around over your head.
You're on a <radical>scooter</radical> and suddenly someone throws a <radical>hot pepper</radical> at you and you have to <kanji>dodge</kanji> it.
A <radical>woman</radical> sleeps with the <radical>king</radical> and becomes <kanji>pregnant</kanji>. Only the king wasn’t human and now the woman is pregnant with a hybrid alien baby!
A <radical>woman</radical> who has a <radical>landslide</radical> getting ready inside her is <kanji>pregnant</kanji>. And that baby is gonna come out like a landslide.
A <radical>mole</radical> in <radical>winter</radical> will <kanji>do</kanji> whatever you ask, if you know how to ask it.
You got your copy of "The <radical>Dry</radical> <radical>Knife</radical>." It's the newest <kanji>edition</kanji> of the magazine you love on keeping your knives dry.
When it's <radical>spring</radical> in <radical>heaven</radical> they <kanji>play music</kanji>. To your mortal, human ears it sounds more like snow melting, birds chirping, and plants waking up.

A <radical>leader</radical> asks <radical>half</radical> of his men to <kanji>accompany</kanji> him on a secret mission. The leader’s mission is volunteer only, so it’s impressive that he got half of his men to accompany him.

A <radical>leader</radical> with <radical>horns</radical> takes a <radical>lantern</radical> and searches for people to <kanji>join</kanji> him. He needs more people to join his cause so he can get his horns removed. He’s embarrassed of them which is why he only travels at night, hence the lantern.
You <radical>change</radical> this <radical>geoduck</radical> because you want it to <kanji>lean</kanji>. Right now it's standing up straight, but you want it to lean to one side instead.
<radical>Past</radical> <radical>stamp</radical>s usually depict images <kanji>contrary</kanji> to current views.

If there’s a <radical>drop</radical> on your <radical>head</radical> and the <radical>rice</radical> is <radical>big</radical>, you know you’re in the <kanji>interior</kanji>. And by interior, I mean you’re actually inside someone. The rice is big because you’ve shrunk to a tiny size and are inside someone’s stomach. The drop on your head is actually digestive fluid.

A <radical>tiger</radical> needs to <radical>think</radical> and <kanji>consider</kanji> its actions before it attacks. Tigers are smart hunters, so they need to consider all options and really think through a situation.

In your <radical>prefecture</radical>, you come from a long <radical>lineage</radical> of people who share one <radical>heart</radical>. When the heart is passed on to the next in line, it flies out of their body, and <kanji>suspend</kanji>s itself in the sky, for you to take.
The <radical>door</radical> in that <radical>direction</radical> is among a <kanji>cluster</kanji> of doors. You run in the direction of the cluster and one door stands out to you. You enter it.

Where do you put your <radical>fingers</radical> when you're on an <radical>escalator</radical>? On the <kanji>handle</kanji>! Okay, so maybe it's not a handle and more of a railing, but for the sake of this kanji, picture a handle instead.

Use your <radical>fingers</radical> on the <radical>cat pirate</radical> to <kanji>suppress</kanji> him. The cat pirate was attacking you, so you took your fingers and pet his head and scratched his chin. Now he's calm and suppressed. He doesn't even remember why he was attacking you.

Shove your <radical>fingers</radical> into a bowl of <radical>shrimp</radical> to <kanji>select</kanji> the best one. You know your shrimp and you know them well, so you won't settle for anything less than the best. Put your whole arm in there and feel around until you can select the one you want most.

With your <radical>fingers</radical> you pluck some <radical>flowers</radical> in a <radical>rice paddy</radical>, in order to <kanji>draw</kanji> them. Have you ever seen rice paddy flowers? They're beautiful. And if you can draw them, you can capture that beauty and show it to everyone.
Your <radical>boat</radical> holds your <radical>weapon</radical> like a <radical>plate</radical>. So in a way, it's just a <kanji>tray</kanji> for your weapon.
You take a <radical>grain</radical> and fashion it into a <radical>gun</radical> that is <radical>small</radical>, earning you the <kanji>title</kanji> of Small Arms Dealer (or SAD). Congratulations!

The kind of <radical>thread</radical> you'd wrap around <radical>someone</radical> would have to be a <kanji>cord</kanji>. A regular thread wouldn't be strong enough, so you'd definitely use a cord. 

This can also mean <kanji>connection</kanji>, since cords create connections (by tying things together).
The <radical>thread</radical> on this <radical>football</radical> is <kanji>loose</kanji>. We need to tighten up the loose thread on this football or it’s gonna fall apart while we’re playing.

They <radical>say</radical> if you put things on a <radical>slide</radical>, <radical>seven</radical> things to be exact, that’s the best way to <kanji>consign</kanji> goods to someone. They say if you consign seven things to someone, you should send them over on a slide. Slide ‘em on down. All seven of ‘em.

The more <radical>shellfish</radical> you <radical>have</radical>, the more you can <kanji>bribe</kanji> people. That worked in the olden days when shells were money, and today too if the people you want to bribe really like seafood.
Someone is offering you a <radical>shellfish</radical> in exchange for a <radical>kiss</radical>. This is a <kanji>bribe</kanji>! You don't want to kiss them, but that shellfish sure looks tasty.
You put on the <radical>shellfish</radical> <radical>mask</radical> once per year and break into people's beach houses, leaving behind <kanji>presents</kanji>.
You use your <radical>scooter</radical> when the <radical>omen</radical> comes so that you can <kanji>escape</kanji>.

There's a <radical>scooter</radical> coming toward you with a <radical>net</radical> trapping a weird <radical>zombie</radical> on it. You don't want this here, so you decide to <kanji>send back</kanji> the zombie. (It's a weird zombie because it has the ground on top of its head instead of dirt!)

Under the <radical>moon</radical> beneath a <radical>tree</radical> there is a <radical>hat</radical> filled with <radical>water</radical>. You stare down into the water and decide to stick your <kanji>knee</kanji> in it.
Your <radical>mouth</radical> has a <radical>tooth</radical> that you use to <kanji>bite</kanji> and <kanji>chew</kanji> with.

You offer a <radical>hot pepper</radical> to the <radical>king</radical>, and he gives you a <radical>drop</radical> of something. You look down at the drop to see it transforming into a <kanji>disc</kanji>. And not just any old disc at that. It's a <kanji>jade disc</kanji>.

Have you ever seen ancient Chinese jade discs with holes in the middle? That's what this kanji is referring to.
